intro: Neokoehleria kroemeri, commonly known as the Kroemeri's grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale blue to purple flowers, which bloom during the rainy season. Neokoehleria kroemeri is adapted to thrive in poor soils and can withstand periods of drought due to its deep root system. It is often found in open grasslands and rocky outcrops, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
